description.narrative: By 2020, justice professionals have increased capacity to manage cases involving children in contact with the law in accordance with international justice for children standards.

mailing-address.narrative: 2nd floor Poytakht Business Centre 16 Sharof Rashidov Street Tashkent 100029

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Alternative care reform and service provision
Justice sector workforce strengthening and capacity building (including police)
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Republic of Uzbekistan
Rep of Uzbekistan Country Programme Document 2016-2020
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Republic of Uzbekistan: Formative Evaluation of the Child Rights Monitoring Programme in Uzbekistan 2016-2018
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, justice professionals have increased capacity to manage cases involving children in contact with the law in accordance with international justice for children standards.

description.narrative: Justice for children has been placed in the current justice policy agenda, leading to replicating child-friendly investigation rooms for child victims and witnesses of crimes all over the country and promoting the application of diversion with restorative justice for children in conflict with the law. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of justice professionals have increased knowledge and skills on a diversion or alternative measure as opposed to a custodial sentence for children in conflict with the law
Number of justice professionals that have been certified in and dealing with child victims and witnesses of crimes
Number of children in any form of detention who are released as part of COVID-19 release/amnesty [COVID] v) total adolescents, 15-17
Number of children in any form of detention who are released as part of COVID-19 release/amnesty [COVID] iv) adolescent girls, 10-14
Percentage of girls in detention benefited the social work case management for re-integration into family type care
